original: kun nas sgo zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: kun nas sgo zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: sgo bzhi pa yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: des ni grub zhi la sogs pa thams cad blta bar bstan to //

analyzed: lte ba zhes bya ba @84b la sogs pas ni go cha gnyis ston pa yin te dpral steng zhes bya ba ni mgo bo /

analyzed: dang po zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor ma drug gi sngags dang por btub bstan pas na dang po ste /

original: gnas lnga po der dpa' bo ste yi ge h'um gis byin gyis brlab pa ste bkod la bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas lnga po der dpa' bo ste yi ge h'um gis byin gyis brlab pa ste bkod la bsrung bar bya'o //

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /

analyzed: h'um gis kun du mkhas pas bsrung //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The wise one protects with h≈´·πÉ.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /

analyzed: dpa' bo dang ni rnal 'byor ma // gnyis med cho ga ji bzhin du //

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /

translated: What is to be practiced by the hero and nondual union?üîΩIt is said:

original: gsungs pa / mgal me'i 'khor lo la gnas pa ;
analyzed: gsungs pa / mgal me'i 'khor lo la gnas pa ;

original: / zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: de nyid kyis na 'khor zhes bya ba gsungs te /

original: bcos ma la rnam par 'khrul pa'o //üîΩde bzhin zhes bya ba ni nye bar sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: bcos ma la rnam par 'khrul pa'o //üîΩde bzhin zhes bya ba ni nye bar sbyar ba ste /

analyzed: zhes bya ba la yid ni yid tsam ste sems tsam mo ;
translated: Mind is the mere mind, the mere mental faculty.

original: / shugs ni de'i 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: / shugs ni de'i 'jug pa'o //

original: rig pa che ni rang rig pa yin pa'i phyir ste /
analyzed: rig pa che ni rang rig pa yin pa'i phyir ste /

original: de dag gis ni mkha' 'gro ma //
analyzed: de dag gis ni mkha' 'gro ma //

original: ci 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'dra zhe na /
translated: What are they like?

original: lha'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lha'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te go sla'o //

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?üîΩIt is said: ‚ÄúThe six perfections‚Äù,

original: gsungs pa / pha rol phyin pa rnam pa drug / ces bya ba ste ;
analyzed: gsungs pa / pha rol phyin pa rnam pa drug / ces bya ba ste ;
translated: and

original: drug ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: drug ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The six are generosity and so forth.

original: pha rol ni rnam par dag cing mthar gtugs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: pha rol ni rnam par dag cing mthar gtugs pa'i mtshan nyid do //

original: phyin pa ni son pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: phyin pa ni son pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The one who has gone is the one who has arrived, the nature of the Tathagata.

analyzed: de ltar na pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa 'dis rnal 'byor ma drug gi sngags rnam par dag pa bstan te /
translated: Thus, by this aspect of the perfections, the purity of the mantras of the six yoginis is taught,

original: ye shes rnyed pa'i ngo bo nyid du ston to //
analyzed: ye shes rnyed pa'i ngo bo nyid du ston to //
translated: and it is shown to be the very essence of the attainment of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du dpa' bo'i go cha drug ni nyon mongs pa drug rnam par dag pa yin par shes par yang bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dpa' bo'i go cha drug ni nyon mongs pa drug rnam par dag pa yin par shes par yang bya'o //
translated: Likewise, it should be understood that the six armors of the hero are the purification of the six afflictions.

original: dbang bskur ba'i rjes la mchod pa bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba'i rjes la mchod pa bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach that after the empowerment, offerings should be made,

original: de nas dbang bskur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te go sla'o //
analyzed: de nas dbang bskur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te go sla'o //
translated: [the BhagavƒÅn] declares, ‚ÄúThen, the empowerment,‚Äù and so on, which is easy to understand.

original: smon pa'i sems kyi rjes la 'jug pa'i sems bsgom pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: smon pa'i sems kyi rjes la 'jug pa'i sems bsgom pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the cultivation of the engaged mind after the aspiring mind,

original: bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the BhagavƒÅn] declares ‚Äúone‚Äôs own,‚Äù and so on.

original: bdag nyid ha ru kar byas nas sems can thams cad he ru kar bya'o snyam pa 'di ni smon pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid ha ru kar byas nas sems can thams cad he ru kar bya'o snyam pa 'di ni smon pa'o //

original: dpal ldan he ru ka dran bya //
analyzed: dpal ldan he ru ka dran bya //
translated: One should recall the glorious Heruka.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i sems te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i sems te /

original: he ru ka bsgom zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: he ru ka bsgom zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: dam tshig dang ye shes kyi sems dpa' gcig tu bya ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: dam tshig dang ye shes kyi sems dpa' gcig tu bya ba gsungs pa /
translated: It is said that the pledge and wisdom beings should be made into one:

original: dam tshig ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dam tshig ni dam tshig gi sems dpa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dam tshig ni dam tshig gi sems dpa'o //
translated: Pledge and wisdom and so forth. The pledge being is the pledge.

original: ye shes ni ye shes kyi sems dpa'o //
analyzed: ye shes ni ye shes kyi sems dpa'o //
translated: The wisdom being is the wisdom.

original: gcig tu gyur pa ni 'dres shing ro gcig tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gcig tu gyur pa ni 'dres shing ro gcig tu gyur pa'o //
translated: Becoming one means merging and becoming of one taste.

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the result of that?

original: des 'di rdo rje can chen brjod //
analyzed: des 'di rdo rje can chen brjod //
translated: It is said, By that one is called a great vajra holder.

original: ces bya ba ste des zhes bya ba ni dam tshig dang ye shes 'dres pa des so //
analyzed: ces bya ba ste des zhes bya ba ni dam tshig dang ye shes 'dres pa des so //
translated: By that means by the merging of the pledge and wisdom beings.

original: rdo rje can chen 'di zhes bya ba ni sems kyis te rang bzhin med par rig pas so //
analyzed: rdo rje can chen 'di zhes bya ba ni sems kyis te rang bzhin med par rig pas so //
translated: This great vajra holder is the mind, because it is known to be without intrinsic nature.

original: brjod pa ni gdon pa ste /
analyzed: brjod pa ni gdon pa ste /
translated: Called means proclaimed.üîΩ

original: aom yo ga shuddha: sarbba dharmm'a yog @87a * //
analyzed: aom yo ga shuddha: sarbba dharmm'a yog @87a * //
translated: O·πÉ yoga≈õuddha·∏• sarvadharmƒÅ yoga·πÉ mayi sthƒÅpaya.üîΩ

original: shuddho& ham / zhes bya ba'o //üîΩbstan pa de dag mdor bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: shuddho& ham / zhes bya ba'o // bstan pa de dag mdor bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: O·πÉ yoga≈õuddha·∏• sarvadharma yogƒÅ≈õuddho 'ham.

original: rnal 'byor 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to summarize those teachings, he declares, This yoga, etc.

original: rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni dam tshig dang ye shes kyi sems dpa' mnyam par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni dam tshig dang ye shes kyi sems dpa' mnyam par sbyor ba'o //

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: This is the BhagavƒÅn.

original: mchod chen zhes bya ba ni mchod pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: mchod chen zhes bya ba ni mchod pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: Great worship is the four kinds of worship.

original: sngags kyi dgod pa zhes bya ba ni go cha'i sngags la sogs pa dgod pa'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi dgod pa zhes bya ba ni go cha'i sngags la sogs pa dgod pa'o //
translated: The mantra array is the array of the armor mantra, etc.

original: dpa' bo mchod pa zhes bya ba ni brda'i mtshan nyid dang / tshogs kyi mchod pa'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo mchod pa zhes bya ba ni brda'i mtshan nyid dang / tshogs kyi mchod pa'o //

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: phyin ci log tu nges par sbyar //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu nges par sbyar //

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyud 'di las sngags la sogs pa thams cad phyin ci log tu sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyud 'di las sngags la sogs pa thams cad phyin ci log tu sbyar ba ste /

original: man ngag las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: man ngag las shes par bya'o //

original: las kyi mdog tu rnam par bsgom //
analyzed: las kyi mdog tu rnam par bsgom //

original: zhes bya ba ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i las dang mthun pa'i mdog tu bsgom pa ste zhi ba la dkar po'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i las dang mthun pa'i mdog tu bsgom pa ste zhi ba la dkar po'o //

original: rgyas pa la ni ser po zhes bya ba la sogs par blta'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa la ni ser po zhes bya ba la sogs par blta'o //

original: de nyid dbye bas phye nas ni //
analyzed: de nyid dbye bas phye nas ni //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la de nyid dbye ba ni las kyi dbye ba'o //

analyzed: phye ba ni nges sngags kyi phreng bas khyad par du bya ba'o //

original: rtsa'i lam zhes bya ba ni rdo rje dang padma'i lam du'o //
analyzed: rtsa'i lam zhes bya ba ni rdo rje dang padma'i lam du'o //

analyzed: sbyar bar bya ba ni lam de nas sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis sbyar bar shes par bya'o //

analyzed: sbyor ba'i don kun la zhes bya ba ni las thams cad de bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel to //

original: cis she na /
analyzed: cis she na /

analyzed: dga' ba chen po 'dis te 'das ma thag pa'i sbyor ba des so //

original: ci zhig bsgrub par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig bsgrub par bya zhe na /

original: lha dang lha min zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lha dang lha min zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /

original: tha mal pa'i lha dang lha min te lha ma yin dang mir bcas te mi dang byol song la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tha mal pa'i lha dang lha min te lha ma yin dang mir bcas te mi dang byol song la sogs pa'o //

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //

analyzed: skye bar ston pa de ni rim par phye bas te bcu gsum pa'o //

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i rnam par bshad pa las le'u bcu gsum pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i rnam par bshad pa las le'u bcu gsum pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /

analyzed: // /'khor lo gsum la dbang sgyur ba'i rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi phyi dang nang gi gnas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: mgo ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste mgo ni skra'i skye gnas so //
translated: The back is the staff of the spine.üîΩThe eyes are the two eyes.üîΩThe arms are to be seen as two.üîΩThe shoulders are the two shoulders.üîΩThe hands are the two hands.üîΩThe feet are the two feet.üîΩThe navel is the navel.üîΩThe heart is the heart.

translated: Likewise, the knee should be seen as two.

original: sa 'og ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang sngar bshad pa bzhin rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis brdar brtags pa blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: sa 'og ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang sngar bshad pa bzhin rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis brdar brtags pa blta bar bya ste /
translated: The underworld and so forth should be seen as the conventional symbols of the yoginis, as explained before.

original: 'di ltar 'dzam bu'i gling nyid kyi yul dang gnas de dag na rnal 'byor ma rnams bzhugs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dzam bu'i gling nyid kyi yul dang gnas de dag na rnal 'byor ma rnams bzhugs te /
translated: Thus, the yoginis dwell in those places and countries of Jambudvipa.

original: gling 'di nyid las kyis yin pas las rnams 'grub par 'gyur gyi gling gzhan rnams na ni de nyid kyi las kyis der 'bras bu smin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gling 'di nyid las kyis yin pas las rnams 'grub par 'gyur gyi gling gzhan rnams na ni de nyid kyi las kyis der 'bras bu smin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Since this continent is the continent of karma, karma is accomplished. But in the other continents, karma does not accomplish its result there, by its own karma, because it is the result of another.

original: gzhan gyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir de dag tu las mi 'grub pas rnal 'byor ma rnams gling gzhan du mi gshegs so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir de dag tu las mi 'grub pas rnal 'byor ma rnams gling gzhan du mi gshegs so //
translated: The yoginis do not go to the other continents because karma is not accomplished there.

original: gser gling ni 'dzam bu'i gling dang nye ba'i phyir gzung ngo //
analyzed: gser gling ni 'dzam bu'i gling dang nye ba'i phyir gzung ngo //
translated: Because the continent of gold is near the continent of Jambu, it is included.

original: rang lus skyes pa'i yul 'di dag ces bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyi so so'i lus kyi gnas m'a la ya la sogs pa'i brdar byas pa rnams nang gi 'dzam bu'i gling zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩphyi dang nang na yang dag gnas //

translated: These countries where one's body is born means that the individual bodies of all sentient beings are the inner continent of Jambu, symbolized by Malaya and so on.üîΩIt is said to be located both outside and inside.

original: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar phyi rol bzhin du nang du shes par bya la nang bzhin du yang phyi rol shes par bya ste /

analyzed: pulli radang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi bya ba'i sgo nas khyad par bstan pa yin no //

analyzed: de la 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' dag tu 'khor ba ji srid par sems can rnams kyi 'dod pa'i don rnam pa sna tshogs pa rnams dus gcig tu sh'akya thub pa la sogs pa'i gzugs sna tshogs kyis rgyun mi 'chad par 'gro ba thams cad la
translated: Thus, as long as cyclic existence lasts in all world systems, the various desired aims of sentient beings are simultaneously and uninterruptedly accomplished by various forms such as ≈öƒÅkyamuni for all transmigrating beings

original: mnyam pa nyid du phan 'dogs par mdzad pa 'di ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid du phan 'dogs par mdzad pa 'di ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: in a manner that is equal to them. This is the emanation body of the buddhas.

original: de la byang chub kyi phyogs rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / zad par gyi skye mched bcu dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad dang /
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi phyogs rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / zad par gyi skye mched bcu dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad dang /
translated: the nine serial absorptions,üîΩthe ten powers,üîΩthe eight bases of subjugation,üîΩthe ten totalities,üîΩthe ten masteries,

original: nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / rnam pa thams cad du yongs su dag pa bzhi dang / dbang bcu dang / stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / rnam pa thams cad du yongs su dag pa bzhi dang / dbang bcu dang / stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang /
translated: the four forms of fearlessness,üîΩthe three closely placed recollections,üîΩthe three establishments of mindfulness,üîΩthe nature of nonforgetfulness,üîΩthe complete destruction of the latent tendencies,

original: srung ba med pa gsum dang / dran pa nye bar gnas pa gsum dang / bsnyel ba med pa'i chos nyid dang / bag chags yang dag par bcom pa dang / thugs rje chen po skyes pa dang / thub pa rnams kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang /
analyzed: srung ba med pa gsum dang / dran pa nye bar gnas pa gsum dang / bsnyel ba med pa'i chos nyid dang / bag chags yang dag par bcom pa dang / thugs rje chen po skyes pa dang / thub pa rnams kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang /
translated: the arising of great compassion,üîΩand the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ste /
translated: The knowledge of all aspects is the knowledge of all things as theyüîΩare and in their full variety.

original: de dag ni thub pa rnams kyi chos kyi sku zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de dag ni thub pa rnams kyi chos kyi sku zhes brjod do //
translated: These are called the Dharma body of the Muni.

original: de la lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de la lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nas bzung ste /
translated: The four foundations of mindfulness, beginning with the body,

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya ba'i bar du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong pa bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun rnams dang /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya ba'i bar du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong pa bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun rnams dang /
translated: up to right concentration are the four foundations of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of manifestation, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven members of enlightenment,üîΩand the eightfold noble path.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa rnams ni byang chub kyi phyogs te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa rnams ni byang chub kyi phyogs te /
translated: These are the factors of enlightenment,

original: nyan thos kyi byang chub la sogs pa thams cad dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi byang chub la sogs pa thams cad dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: which are in accord with all the enlightenments, such as the enlightenment of the disciples.

original: tshad med pa rnams ni snying rje la sogs pa tshangs pa'i gnas pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa rnams ni snying rje la sogs pa tshangs pa'i gnas pa bzhi'o //
translated: The immeasurables are the four Brahma abodes, such as compassion.

original: de la gzugs can gzugs rnams la blta ba dang / nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi'i gzugs la blta ba dang / dag pa'i rnam par thar pa lus kyis mngon sum du @90a * //
analyzed: de la gzugs can gzugs rnams la blta ba dang / nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi'i gzugs la blta ba dang / dag pa'i rnam par thar pa lus kyis mngon sum du @90a * //
translated: The first three are the liberation of the eye seeing forms, the liberation of the perception of the internal body as formless and the liberation of the body manifesting the pure liberation.üîΩThe next four are the base of infinite space, the base of infinite consciousness, the base of nothingness and the base of neither perception nor nonperception.

original: byas te gnas pa gsum dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas dang / rnam shes mtha' yas dang / ci yang med pa dang / 'du shes med min skye mched bzhi dang / 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa ste /

translated: The last is the cessation of discriminations and feelings.

original: brgyad po de dag rnam par thar pa rnams so //
analyzed: brgyad po de dag rnam par thar pa rnams so //
translated: These eight are the liberations.

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa ste /
translated: The four concentrations of the form realm, the four formless absorptions and the cessation of discriminations and feelings.

original: dgu po de dag ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams so //
analyzed: dgu po de dag ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams so //
translated: These nine are the serial absorptions.

original: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung rnams dang / sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnams dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam par shes pa rnams su ril bsgom pa ni zad par gyi skye mched bcu'o //

analyzed: de dag ni mtho ris kyi lam dang thun mong ba'o //
translated: The four knowledges and views are as follows:üîΩThe four knowledges and views that

original: rang dang gzhan dag gi rgyud la yod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rgyun ting nge 'dzin gang gis spong bar byed pa ni nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan dag gi rgyud la yod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rgyun ting nge 'dzin gang gis spong bar byed pa ni nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: The concentration by which one abandons the continuity of the defilements in oneself and in others is the absence of defilement.

original: de rnams thams cad du mtshan ma dang / bag chags spangs nas the tshom rnam par bsal te /
analyzed: de rnams thams cad du mtshan ma dang / bag chags spangs nas the tshom rnam par bsal te /
translated: Having abandoned all signs and instincts, having eliminated doubts,

original: 'khor ba ni ji srid pa'i bar du smon lam rnam par dag pa spel zhing mnyam par gzhag pa la 'jug pa'i gnas skabs 'di ni smon nas shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba ni ji srid pa'i bar du smon lam rnam par dag pa spel zhing mnyam par gzhag pa la 'jug pa'i gnas skabs 'di ni smon nas shes pa'o //
translated: one increases pure aspirations for as long as samsara lasts. This is the knowledge through resolve.

original: lha'i mig la sogs pa ni mngon par shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: lha'i mig la sogs pa ni mngon par shes pa rnams so //
translated: The divine eye, etc. are the superknowledges.

original: chos so so yang dag par rig pa la sogs pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: chos so so yang dag par rig pa la sogs pa bzhi ni /
translated: The four beginning with the analytical knowledge of the teachings are

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams te /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams te /
translated: the analytical knowledges.

original: rten dang / dmigs pa dang / sems dang ye shes rnams yongs su dag pa bzhir sbyar ro //
analyzed: rten dang / dmigs pa dang / sems dang ye shes rnams yongs su dag pa bzhir sbyar ro //
translated: They are to be connected with the four purities of basis, object, mind, and knowledge.

original: tshe dang / sems dang / yo byad dang / las dang / skye ba dang / thabs dang / mos pa dang / smon lam dang / rnam par shes pa dang / chos la @90b dbang ba rnams ni dbang bcu'o //
analyzed: tshe dang / sems dang / yo byad dang / las dang / skye ba dang / thabs dang / mos pa dang / smon lam dang / rnam par shes pa dang / chos la @90b dbang ba rnams ni dbang bcu'o //
translated: The ten masteries are mastery over life, mind, material objects, action, birth, aspiration, resolution, knowledge, and Dharma.

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la sogs pa zag pa zad par mkhyen pa'i bar du bcu ni stobs rnams so //üîΩchos thams cad mngon par rdzogs pa byang chub pa la mi 'jigs pa nas phun sum tshogs pa thams cad thob par 'gyur ba nges par 'byung ba'i lam de bzhin du 'gyur ba la mi 'jigs pa'i bar du bzhi ni /
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la sogs pa zag pa zad par mkhyen pa'i bar du bcu ni stobs rnams so // chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs pa byang chub pa la mi 'jigs pa nas phun sum tshogs pa thams cad thob par 'gyur ba nges par 'byung ba'i lam de bzhin du 'gyur ba la mi 'jigs pa'i bar du bzhi ni /
translated: The ten powers are the power to know what is possible and what is not, and so on up to the power to know the exhaustion of defilements.

original: mi 'jigs pa rnams so //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa rnams so //
translated: The four fearlessnesses are fearlessness in proclaiming perfect enlightenment with regard to all phenomena, fearlessness in proclaiming the elimination of all negative factors, fearlessness in proclaiming the path that leads to perfect deliverance, and fearlessness in proclaiming the factors that obstruct the path.üîΩThe four aspects of correct knowledge are correct knowledge of phenomena, their meaning, their expression, and their eloquence.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi phrin las kyi spyod pa rnams yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi phrin las kyi spyod pa rnams yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: The eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha are the three groups of six distinctive qualities, such as the absence of mistakes, and so on.üîΩThe ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the three closely placed recollections, and great compassion are the thirty-four common qualities of the Buddha.üîΩThe ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the three closely placed recollections, and great compassion are the thirty-four common qualities of the Buddha.üîΩThe ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the three closely placed recollections, and great compassion are the thirty-four common qualities of the Buddha.üîΩThe ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the three closely placed recollections, and great compassion are the thirty-four common qualities of the Buddha.üîΩThe ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the three closely placed recollections, and great compassion are the thirty-four common qualities of the Buddha.üîΩThe ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the three closely placed recollections, and great compassion are the thirty-four common qualities of the Buddha.

original: spyod pa de dag yongs su ma dag pa gzhan gyis shes par gyur na mi rung ngo zhes yongs su sred cing srung ba med pa rnams so //
analyzed: spyod pa de dag yongs su ma dag pa gzhan gyis shes par gyur na mi rung ngo zhes yongs su sred cing srung ba med pa rnams so //
translated: They are not concerned with concealing their behavior, fearing that others might know of their impure conduct.

original: chos ston pa la rna ba btud da nyan pa dang / mi nyan pa dang / gnyis ka'i mtshan nyid can la sems btang snyoms su mdzad pa ni dran pa nye bar gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: chos ston pa la rna ba btud da nyan pa dang / mi nyan pa dang / gnyis ka'i mtshan nyid can la sems btang snyoms su mdzad pa ni dran pa nye bar gnas pa rnams so //
translated: They are mindful, for they are indifferent to those who listen to their teaching of the Dharma, to those who do not, and to those who both listen and do not.

original: sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i dus las mi 'da' ba'i mtshan nyid 'di ni bsnyel ba med pa'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i dus las mi 'da' ba'i mtshan nyid 'di ni bsnyel ba med pa'i chos nyid do //
translated: This is the nature of their nonforgetfulness, which is characterized by their never missing the time for acting for the welfare of beings.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa rnams kyis bon dang bag la nyal rtsad nas bton pa 'di ni bag chags yang dag par spangs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa rnams kyis bon dang bag la nyal rtsad nas bton pa 'di ni bag chags yang dag par spangs pa'o //
translated: This is their complete abandonment of habitual tendencies, which is the complete uprooting of the seeds and dormant tendencies of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa med pa zhes bya ba nas da ltar gyi dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i bar du ni ma 'dres pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa med pa zhes bya ba nas da ltar gyi dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i bar du ni ma 'dres pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: The TathƒÅgatas are free from error, and so on up to: they have the vision of unobstructed and unattached intuition in the present.

original: thugs rje chen po zhes bya ba ni grags par zad do //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po zhes bya ba ni grags par zad do //
translated: Great compassion is well known.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus brgyan pa'i yongs su dag pa'i sku 'khor los sgyur ba'i cha byad can 'di ni thub pa rnams kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ru bzhed de /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus brgyan pa'i yongs su dag pa'i sku 'khor los sgyur ba'i cha byad can 'di ni thub pa rnams kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ru bzhed de /
translated: The body of enjoyment of the victors is adorned with the thirty-two marks and the eighty signs of a great person, and it is pure, like the body of a universal ruler.

original: sa bcu la bzhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang lhan cig tu kha na mtho ba med par theg pa chen po'i chos la longs spyod pas dga' ba dang bde ba'i ro nyams su bstar ba'o //
analyzed: sa bcu la bzhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang lhan cig tu kha na mtho ba med par theg pa chen po'i chos la longs spyod pas dga' ba dang bde ba'i ro nyams su bstar ba'o //
translated: It is the body of enjoyment of the victors, because it is the experience of the great joy and bliss of the Dharma of the universal vehicle, which is free from error, together with the bodhisattvas who are on the ten stages.

original: gang zag pa med pa'i chos rnams ni rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa brnyes pa 'di ni thub pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi sku ste /üîΩgang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams dang rang bzhin gyis chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid zag pa med pa yin pa las glo bur gyi dri ma dang bral te /üîΩrnam pa thams cad yongs su dag cing bden @91a * //
analyzed: gang zag pa med pa'i chos rnams ni rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa brnyes pa 'di ni thub pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi sku ste / gang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams dang rang bzhin gyis chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid zag pa med pa yin pa las glo bur gyi dri ma dang bral te / rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag cing bden @91a * //
translated: The dharmakƒÅya of the sages is the attainment of the complete purity of all aspects of the uncontaminated dharmas.üîΩThe uncontaminated dharmas, such as the applications of mindfulness, are by nature the completely pure dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: pa thob pa 'di ni ma bcos pa'i rang bzhin gyi sku yin no //
analyzed: pa thob pa 'di ni ma bcos pa'i rang bzhin gyi sku yin no //
translated: The attainment of the truth of the complete purity of all aspects of the uncontaminated dharmas free from the stains of adventitious contaminants is the unfabricated natural body.üîΩThus the four bodies are presented in the manner of a wheel, with the hub and so on.

original: de ltar sku rnam pa bzhi po 'khor lo'i tshul gyis lte ba la sogs par rim bzhin du rnam par gzhag pa dang / le'u bcu gcig par /

translated: In the eleventh chapter,

analyzed: dang por chos kyi 'byung gnas bsam //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs par mdor bstan pa bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain this brief presentation, the commentary says:

original: ya ra la wa bzhi ni bdun pa'o //

original: sha sha sa ha bzhi ni brgyad pa'o //

original: padma'i dbus kyi 'dab ma brgyad la kun nas bskor te bri par bya'o //üîΩsngags rnams thams cad 'byung ba ste //
analyzed: padma'i dbus kyi 'dab ma brgyad la kun nas bskor te bri par bya'o // sngags rnams thams cad 'byung ba ste //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sngags rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //üîΩ'byung ba ni 'khor lo 'di bsgom pa goms pa phul du byung ba las skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sngags rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so // 'byung ba ni 'khor lo 'di bsgom pa goms pa phul du byung ba las skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: The origin of all mantras and so forth. The mantras are the TathƒÅgatas.

original: gang gi phyir de rnams kyis sprul pa'i sku thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan yang ci yang rung ba skye //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de rnams kyis sprul pa'i sku thob par byed pa'i phyir ro // gzhan yang ci yang rung ba skye //

original: zhes bya ba ni brtan pa dang g-yo ba rnams de las skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni brtan pa dang g-yo ba rnams de las skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, anything whatsoever arises means that the stable and unstable arise from that.

original: yang na sde tshan brgyad kyi yi ge 'di dag las sngags kyi de kho na nyid 'byung ba dang / gzhan yang zhes bya ba sangs rgyas nyid dang thun mong gi dngos grub phra mo gzhan dag kyang skye ba'o //
analyzed: yang na sde tshan brgyad kyi yi ge 'di dag las sngags kyi de kho na nyid 'byung ba dang / gzhan yang zhes bya ba sangs rgyas nyid dang thun mong gi dngos grub phra mo gzhan dag kyang skye ba'o //
translated: Or else, the reality of mantra arises from these syllables of the eight classes, and also other minor powers in common with Buddhahood.

analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo gsungs pa /

original: chos kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

original: lus can rnams kyi snying dga' byed //

analyzed: ces bya ba ni thog ma dang tha ma'i dngos grub rnams ster ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: sgra lnga dang ni yang dag ldan //

translated: The five sounds are the first vowel [a], the third [i], the fifth [u], the eleventh [e], and the sixth vowel [o] that is located in the middle below the h≈´·πÉ.

analyzed: ya ral wa zhes bya ba ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i 'khor lo dang yang sbyar te /

original: sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: sngar bshad zin to //
translated: as explained previously.

original: longs spyod kyi 'khor lo gsungs pa longs spyod ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: longs spyod kyi 'khor lo gsungs pa longs spyod ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The enjoyment wheel is stated in ‚Äúenjoyment,‚Äù and so on.

original: ro rnams kyi ni rten rang bzhin //
analyzed: ro rnams kyi ni rten rang bzhin //
translated: The nature of the support of the tastes

analyzed: zhes bya ba la ro ni nyams su myong ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúTastes‚Äù are experiences.

analyzed: rang rig pa'i rang bzhin nyams su myong ba'i rten de 'dzin par byed pa'o //
translated: The support of the experience of the nature of reflexive awareness is the apprehender.

original: cha rnams bzhi po dag gis ni //
analyzed: cha rnams bzhi po dag gis ni //
translated: The four parts

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dbyangs yig gnyis pa dang / bzhi pa dang / lnga pa dang / drug pa dang / bcu gnyis pa rnams so // kun nas yongs su bskor ba ni 'dab ma bcu drug pa'i lte bar /
translated: are the second, fourth, fifth, sixth, and twelfth vowels.üîΩThe complete encirclement is the placement of o·πÉ in the center of the sixteen petals.

original: aom bkod pa'i phyi rol du bskor ba ste /
analyzed: aom bkod pa'i phyi rol du bskor ba ste /
translated: The outer encirclement is

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku thob par byed pa'o //üîΩbde ba chen po'i 'khor lo gsungs pa /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku thob par byed pa'o // bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo gsungs pa /
translated: It causes the attainment of the Enjoyment Body.üîΩThe Great Bliss Cakra is taught:

original: bde ba chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The Great Bliss Cakra, etc.

original: byang chub sum cu gnyis dang ldan //
analyzed: byang chub sum cu gnyis dang ldan //
translated: Endowed with the thirty-two enlightenments,

original: zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi rang bzhin mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis rnam par dag pa'i padma 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis ni byang chub yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi rang bzhin mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis rnam par dag pa'i padma 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis ni byang chub yin la /

original: de'i dbus kyi lte ba la mgo med pa'i ha dang dbyangs kyi yi ge bcu drug 'dab ma rnams la bkod pa ni ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de'i dbus kyi lte ba la mgo med pa'i ha dang dbyangs kyi yi ge bcu drug 'dab ma rnams la bkod pa ni ldan pa ste /
translated: The sixteen vowels are placed in the center of the hub without a head and on the petals, respectively.

original: zag pa med pa'i bde ba chen po'i ngo bo nyid kyi sku thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i bde ba chen po'i ngo bo nyid kyi sku thob par byed pa'o //
translated: It causes the attainment of the Body which is the nature of the uncontaminated Great Bliss.

original: zla ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la zla ba ni g-yon pa'o //
analyzed: zla ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la zla ba ni g-yon pa'o //
translated: The Moon, etc. The Moon is the left.

original: nyi ma ni g-yas pa'o //
analyzed: nyi ma ni g-yas pa'o //
translated: The Sun is the right.

original: su'i zhe na dpa' bo mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyi ste skyes pa dang bud med rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: su'i zhe na dpa' bo mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyi ste skyes pa dang bud med rnams kyi'o //
translated: Of whom? Of the heroes and dakinis, i.e., of the men and women.

original: de dag gis ni skyes pa dang bud med mtshon par byed do //
analyzed: de dag gis ni skyes pa dang bud med mtshon par byed do //
translated: Those indicate the male and female.

original: 'gro dang 'ong ba nges par brjod //
analyzed: 'gro dang 'ong ba nges par brjod //
translated: Going and coming are said to be definite.

original: ces bya ba la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba ni g-yas dang g-yon gyi rlung gi 'jug pa dang 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba ni g-yas dang g-yon gyi rlung gi 'jug pa dang 'byung ba yin la /
translated: In this regard, going and coming are the entry and emergence of the right and left winds.

original: nges par brjod pa ni de dag dgos pa sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: nges par brjod pa ni de dag dgos pa sgrub pa'o //
translated: Definite is the accomplishment of their purpose.

original: yang na mkha' 'gro ma dang bcas pa'i dpa' bo rnams 'gro ba dang 'ong ba rgyu zhes bya bar brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na mkha' 'gro ma dang bcas pa'i dpa' bo rnams 'gro ba dang 'ong ba rgyu zhes bya bar brjod par bya ste /
translated: Or, it should be said that the heroes together with the dakinis go and come, moving.

original: ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is that?

original: g-yas g-yon gyi rlung ste /
analyzed: g-yas g-yon gyi rlung ste /
translated: The right and left winds.

original: rlung la zhon nas 'gro 'ong byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rlung la zhon nas 'gro 'ong byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they go and come riding on the winds.

original: de ltar nang du'ang bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar nang du'ang bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that in the same way internally,

original: gnas gnyis pa ni mnyam par @92a * //üîΩzhon // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gnas gnyis pa ni mnyam par @92a * // zhon // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the second place is evenly mounted.

original: gnas dang 'dra bas na gnas te g-yas g-yon gyi rtsa'o //
analyzed: gnas dang 'dra bas na gnas te g-yas g-yon gyi rtsa'o //
translated: The two places are the right and left channels.

original: mnyam pa ni der rgyu ba'i rlung ngo //
analyzed: mnyam pa ni der rgyu ba'i rlung ngo //
translated: Even is the wind moving there.

original: zhon pa ni sems kyi ting nge 'dzin ces bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: zhon pa ni sems kyi ting nge 'dzin ces bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Riding is the mind's meditative concentration.

original: 'og dang steng du yang dag brtan //
analyzed: 'og dang steng du yang dag brtan //
translated: Firmly established above and below.

original: ces bya ba la 'og ni lte ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba la 'og ni lte ba'o //
translated: Below is the navel.

original: steng ni spyi gtsug go //
analyzed: steng ni spyi gtsug go //
translated: Above is the crown of the head.

original: brten pa ni rtsa ba dang rtse mo nger sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: brten pa ni rtsa ba dang rtse mo nger sbyar ba'o //
translated: Firmly established means that the base and the tip are joined.

original: dbyangs yig bcu gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dbyangs yig bcu gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The twelve vowels, etc.

original: sgra yin pas na dbyangs te ma ning spangs pa'i dbyangs yig bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: sgra yin pas na dbyangs te ma ning spangs pa'i dbyangs yig bcu gnyis so //
translated: Vowels are so called because of sound, the twelve vowels excluding the neutral.

original: steng bltas zhes bya ba ni rtsa gnyis ka las tshangs pa la sogs pa'i rlung phyir rgyu ba ni go rims bzhin sor bzhi dang drug dang bcu gnyis dang bcu drug gi bar du steng gi nam mkha' la rgyu ba na dbyangs kyi yi ge bcu gnyis kyi
analyzed: steng bltas zhes bya ba ni rtsa gnyis ka las tshangs pa la sogs pa'i rlung phyir rgyu ba ni go rims bzhin sor bzhi dang drug dang bcu gnyis dang bcu drug gi bar du steng gi nam mkha' la rgyu ba na dbyangs kyi yi ge bcu gnyis kyi
translated: Looking upward means that the winds of Brahma, etc. , moving out of both channels, move in the space above for a distance of four finger-widths, six finger-widths, twelve finger-widths, and sixteen finger-widths, respectively.

original: skud par brgyu ba'o //üîΩka sogs zhes bya ba ni spel zhes bya ba dang sbyar te /
analyzed: skud par brgyu ba'o // ka sogs zhes bya ba ni spel zhes bya ba dang sbyar te /
translated: The twelve vowels are strung on the thread.üîΩThe consonants, etc.

original: ka la sogs pa dang spel ba'o //
analyzed: ka la sogs pa dang spel ba'o //
translated: The consonants are strung on the thread.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: rlung phyir rgyu ba ni dbyangs kyi skud pa de nyid la de'i rjes su 'jug pa yin pas /
analyzed: rlung phyir rgyu ba ni dbyangs kyi skud pa de nyid la de'i rjes su 'jug pa yin pas /
translated: The exhalation of the wind is the movement of the thread of vowels.

original: ka la sogs pa'i phreng ba bri'o //
analyzed: ka la sogs pa'i phreng ba bri'o //
translated: The garland of ka and so forth is drawn.

original: 'og tu bltas pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe sgo gnyis nas rlung nang du 'jug pa'i tshe /
analyzed: 'og tu bltas pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe sgo gnyis nas rlung nang du 'jug pa'i tshe /
translated: Looking down is when the wind enters through both doors.

original: aa la sogs pa'i skud pa dang ka la sogs pa'i phreng ba kha 'og tu bltas par bri'o //
analyzed: aa la sogs pa'i skud pa dang ka la sogs pa'i phreng ba kha 'og tu bltas par bri'o //
translated: The thread of a and so forth and the garland of ka and so forth are drawn looking down.

original: des na rlung phyir rgyu ba la ni de dag steng du blta bar shes par bya la /
analyzed: des na rlung phyir rgyu ba la ni de dag steng du blta bar shes par bya la /
translated: Thus, when the wind moves out, they should be understood as looking up.

original: nang du 'jug pa la ni 'og tu blta bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: nang du 'jug pa la ni 'og tu blta bar shes par bya'o //
translated: When it moves in, they should be understood as looking down.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says:

original: ngos gnyis zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ngos gnyis zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The two sidesüîΩThe term side is equivalent to similar.

original: ngos kyi sgra ni mtshungs pa yin la gnyis ni 'byung ba dang 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: ngos kyi sgra ni mtshungs pa yin la gnyis ni 'byung ba dang 'jug pa yin no //
translated: The two are the arising and entering.

original: ni zhes bya ba ni nges par gzung ba'o //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni nges par gzung ba'o //
translated: The word ni is a definite marker.

original: kha cig na re ni zhes bya ba ni tshig kha bskang ba yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re ni zhes bya ba ni tshig kha bskang ba yin te /
translated: Some say that ni is a filler word.

original: de yang ji skad du /
analyzed: de yang ji skad du /
translated: That is also stated:

original: ni dang ste dang pa la sogs //
analyzed: ni dang ste dang pa la sogs //
translated: and so on.

original: kha bskang drug tu mkhas pas bshad //
analyzed: kha bskang drug tu mkhas pas bshad //
translated: The wise explain that there are sixüîΩsupplements.

original: ces zer ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces zer ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de ltar na ngos gnyis ni g-yas g-yon gyi phyogs gnyis so //
analyzed: de ltar na ngos gnyis ni g-yas g-yon gyi phyogs gnyis so //
translated: In that way, the two sides are the two directions of right and left.

original: spel ba ni de dang spel ba ste /
analyzed: spel ba ni de dang spel ba ste /
translated: The supplement is that which is supplemented by that.

original: a'a li'i phreng gi g-yas g-yon gnyis su k'a li'i phreng ba gnyis gnyis bri ba'o //
analyzed: a'a li'i phreng gi g-yas g-yon gnyis su k'a li'i phreng ba gnyis gnyis bri ba'o //
translated: Two garlands of ka lis are written to the right and left of the garland of ƒÅ lis.

original: dbus su de ni sbyar bar bya //
analyzed: dbus su de ni sbyar bar bya //
translated: In the middle, that is applied.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In that,

original: de ni g-yas g-yon gyi rlung gi phred ba 'jug pa dang 'byung ba de'o //
analyzed: de ni g-yas g-yon gyi rlung gi phred ba 'jug pa dang 'byung ba de'o //
translated: that is the entry and emergence of the two garlands of vƒÅyus to the right and left.

original: dbus su sbyar ba ni 'jug pa dang 'byung ba de re re zhing yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus rnam @92b pa gsum gsum gyis bskor ba'o //
analyzed: dbus su sbyar ba ni 'jug pa dang 'byung ba de re re zhing yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus rnam @92b pa gsum gsum gyis bskor ba'o //
translated: The application in the middle is that entry and emergence, each of which is surrounded by the three times‚Äîpast, future, and present.

original: gzhung de nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhung de nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to summarize that treatise,

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te go sla'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te go sla'o //
translated: thus and so on is said; it is easy to understand.

original: yang na / de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa rkang pa dang po ni phra mo'i mjug bsdu ba zhes bya ba la rtsa dang sgra'i rang bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rags pa'i rnal 'byor bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na / de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa rkang pa dang po ni phra mo'i mjug bsdu ba zhes bya ba la rtsa dang sgra'i rang bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rags pa'i rnal 'byor bstan pa yin te /
translated: Or else, the first verse beginning thus is the summary of the subtle, and the rest beginning the nature of the channels and sound teaches the gross yoga.

original: de la rtsa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: de la rtsa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: There, the channels are the perfection of wisdom.

original: de yang gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de yang gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: And that is the very nature of nondual intuition.

original: sgra zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i don rjod par byed pa'i tshig gi tshogs te /
analyzed: sgra zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i don rjod par byed pa'i tshig gi tshogs te /
translated: Sound is the collection of words that express the meaning of the natural luminosity of all things.

original: dngos gang zhe na /
analyzed: dngos gang zhe na /
translated: What is the thing?

original: aom pra kri te pra bha sva ra: sarba dharm'a: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: aom pra kri te pra bha sva ra: sarba dharm'a: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is om prakriti prabhasvarah sarvadharmah, etc.

original: rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni mtshungs shing mnyam par bsre ba yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni mtshungs shing mnyam par bsre ba yin te /
translated: The nature is the mixing in equality.

original: 'od gsal bar ston pa'i sgras brjod pa nyid la /
analyzed: 'od gsal bar ston pa'i sgras brjod pa nyid la /
translated: It is the very expression by the sound that reveals luminosity.

original: 'od gsal ba'i don gyis rnam par rtog pa bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'i don gyis rnam par rtog pa bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of luminous is to generate the conception.

original: de nyid rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i rang bzhin nyid du bstan pa'i phyir gnyis med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i rang bzhin nyid du bstan pa'i phyir gnyis med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach just that as the nature of the Vajra dakini, he declares nondual, etc.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes nyid rdo rje'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes nyid rdo rje'o //
translated: Vajra is nondual intuition itself.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gnyis kyi rnam par rtog pa'i dri ma dang bral bas mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam par rtog pa'i dri ma dang bral bas mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is indivisible, being free from the stain of the conception of duality.

original: rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: Nature is the perfection of wisdom by nature.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: ye shes gnyis med gang yin pa //
analyzed: ye shes gnyis med gang yin pa //
translated: That which is nondual intuition

original: rang bzhin shes rab pha rol phyin //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin shes rab pha rol phyin // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
